original_definition: 'shared order book' means a module in the continuous intraday coupling system collecting all matchable orders from the NEMOs participating in single intraday coupling and performing continuous matching of those orders;
generated_definition: 'shared order book' means a shared electronic platform where multiple market participants can submit orders anonymously for execution.
